pr_title: Implement get generated keys only if supported by JDBC

timeline.message:
Improve the supportsGetGeneratedkey() function

Improve the implementation

Change the error message

Fix the reviewed comment

Make changes in the example

Add value in the bal file

timeline.bodyText: What is the reason for appending . at the end instead of the beginning of the line?
timeline.author: anupama-pathirage
daneshk

timeline.bodyText:
Shall we change this to something like below and use that boolean for other two places? That will avoid taking && twice with the same booleans.
boolean retrieveGeneratedKeys = isKeyRetrievalSupportedStatement() && getGeneratedKey
timeline.author: anupama-pathirage

timeline.bodyText: What is the purpose of this method?
timeline.author: anupama-pathirage
daneshk

timeline.bodyText: Normal practice is boolean returned function name = is + boolean variable name. Can we rename the method name or variable name to follow the same practice?
timeline.author: anupama-pathirage

timeline.bodyText: Why do we need to define this constant like this? This is not a jdbc related constant. @daneshk / @wggihan Are we following similar pattern in other modules?
timeline.author: anupama-pathirage

replies.bodyText: AFAIK, directly using annotation without using this kind of constant in other modules.
replies.author: wggihan

timeline.bodyText: We cannot rely on this API to check whether DB driver supports get generated keys. Because there is no guarantee that all DB driver implements this function. IMO we should not use this for our internal logic
timeline.author: daneshk

timeline.bodyText: Instead of this comment, shall we use descriptive name for the function itself. This is the pattern followed for other test cases as well.
timeline.author: anupama-pathirage

timeline.bodyText:
Shall we remove checking keyRetrievalSupportedStatement and only rely on value set by the user?
and pass all the errors we encounter while performing the operation to the user.
timeline.author: daneshk

timeline.message: Make changes in the bal file

timeline.bodyText: Can we add a test case for this scenario as well.
timeline.author: anupama-pathirage

timeline.bodyText: Why do we need this extra check?
timeline.author: daneshk

replies.bodyText: The returnGeneratedKeys only support INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE and MERGE operations So we need to check if the statement has one of these.
replies.author: kalaiyarasiganeshalingam

replies.bodyText: Do we need specifically handle this? what if we not handled and user set return generated keys for other operation. do we get a meaningful error from the driver?
replies.author: daneshk

replies.bodyText: We haven't got a meaningful error from the driver but got an empty ResultSet. So, I specifically handled this.
replies.author: kalaiyarasiganeshalingam

replies.bodyText: @daneshk I too think we don't need to explicitly check this. Isn't it a driver or DB dependent thing whether throwing an exception or returning empty result set. Why we are limiting only to the INSERT, DELETE, UPDATE, MERGE since the developer now has the full control to retrieve the generated keys or not.
replies.author: anupama-pathirage

timeline.message: Change the mendatory parameter to a defaultable parameter
